intro: Banisteriopsis velutinissima, commonly known as the velvet bark tree, is a woody plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, reddish-brown bark that feels velvety to the touch. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, elliptical, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a small, round capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
